fr.inria.atlanmod.commons.io.serializer

Class AbstractSerializer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.inria.atlanmod.commons.io.serializer.AbstractSerializer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of (de)serialized objects
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Converter<T,byte[]>, Serializer<T>, java.io.Serializable, java.util.function.Function<T,byte[]>

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public abstract class AbstractSerializer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Serializer<T>
    An abstract Serializer for objects of type T.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • serialize

        public void serialize(T t,
                      java.io.OutputStream os)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Serializer
        Write an object of type T to the given os.

        If the os also implements DataOutput, prefer using Serializer.serialize(Object, DataOutput). This method will create a adapter on os before calling it.

        Specified by:
        serialize in interface Serializer<T>
        Parameters:
        t - the object to serialize
        os - the output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the serialization

        @Nonnull
public T deserialize(java.io.InputStream is)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Serializer
        Reads and assembles an object of type T from the given is.

        If the is also implements DataInput, prefer using Serializer.deserialize(DataInput). This method will create a adapter on is before calling it.

        Specified by:
